page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY OF FORFAR
page.content: We have many{Famous People}who have lived in Forfar. {Peter Reid}was born here in 1803 and died in 1897, 94 years old.We regard him as Forfar's most generous man.He gave the town its Reid Park and Reid Hall.As Provost of Forfar he donated Â£10,000 towards its improvement.He made a famous sweet 'Peter Reid Rock' in a small low-ceilinged shop in Castle St.with a smaller back room as his sweet factory.This is the message on his statue in the Reid Park.'Donor of this and many other gifts to Forfar. Erected by a grateful community to his revered memory 1898' {Dr.Jamieson}was the author of the Scottish Dictionary in the early 1800s.He was a minister in Forfar for 16 years and wrote this famous reference book during that time.
